page.title: 15BEAUSALE
page.content: { BEAUSALE IS WITHIN AN AREA OF MIXED {FAMLAND AND LIES 3 MILES WEST OF {KENILWORTH, WARWICKSHIRE. THE GRASSLAND IN THE AREA IS DIVIDED INTO PERMANENT PASTURE AND LEY GRASS. THE PASTURE SUPPORTS MAINLY COWS (MILKING AND FATSTOCK CROSS-BREEDS), SOME SHEEP AND HORSES (LEISURE USE). THE ARABLE LAND IS PREDOMINATELY GRAIN (BARLEY AND WHEAT) FOR SALE TO MILLERS AND FOR ANIMAL FEEDSTUFF. { IT IS A SMALL SETTLEMENT WITH 20 TO {30 HOUSES WITH PEOPLE COMMUTING TO {SURROUNDING TOWNS FOR EMPLOYMENT. THERE ARE VERY FEW AMENITIES: BUS SERVICE 4 TIMES A WEEK, WEEKLY MOBILE LIBRARY, POSTAL COLLECTION AND DELIVERY, TELEPHONE CALL BOX. THERE IS NO PUBLIC HOUSE, SCHOOL OR CHURCH. THE HOUSES RANGE FROM 18TH CENTURY COTTAGES TO MODERN LARGE DETATCHED HOUSE IN EXTENSIVE GROUNDS.
